abstracts.cdata!:
This report summarizes the environmental
            management and monitoring plan for the Pilot Water Supply
            and Sanitation Project to ensure that the rehabilitation and
            operation of the water supply systems in the selected cities
            meet the requirements and comply with the environmental laws
            and regulations of Moldova. Some of the measures and
            mitigations of negative impacts are described as follows:
            Follow best management practices to prevent accidental or
            intended release of toxic waters, general prevention of
            water leaks, and control of excavation levels. Employ dust
            suppression measures, use traffic routing measures, and
            periodically test for air pollution. Minimize waste
            generation during construction, reuse construction waste
            where practical, use appropriate methods for storing waste
            materials, and dispose of waste on proper site. Limit
            construction work to normal daylight working hours, and
            employ noise buns or other noise suppression devices.
            Minimize time for replacement operations, and conduct actual
            replacement works during the night time to reduce temporary
            problems related to water quality and interruptions. Provide
            alternative safe access and request detours for pedestrians
            in order to avoid accidents. Dispose of water treatment
            sludge by proper handling, collection, and storage. Prevent
            air pollution from chlorination facilities by implementing
            standards for handling and periodic testing. Identify
            cultural heritage sites and acquire permits.
